results.title: Rape. Part 2. Providing the proof
results.creator_credit: Richard Siegel, Richard Cullather, Karen Smith and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Deals with the preservation of corroborating evidence in the investigation of rape. Offers information on procedures, the establishment of fact, the collection and analysis of demonstrative evidence, the chain of possession, identification procedures and protection for the victim.

results.title: Rape. Part 1. Problems in proof
results.creator_credit: Richard Siegel, Richard Cullather, Karen Smith and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the value of careful investigation, corroboration of the victim’s allegation of rape and the primary responsibility of the investigating officer. Studies evidentiary problems encountered at trial.

results.title: Rape culture
results.creator_credit: Renner Wunderlich, Margaret Margaret Lazarus and Cambridge Documentary Films
results.brief_description: This film explores those elements in our society which contribute to the ideology that supports rape. It attempts to expand our society’s narrow and sexist concept of rape and establishes the connections between violence and “normal” patterns of male-female behaviour. Includes the opinions of convicted rapists, rape crisis centre workers, and others associated with the problem.

results.title: Rap race and equality
results.creator_credit: Grant Elliott, Stephen Elliott, Burberry Productions and Elliott Productions
results.brief_description: Rap and hip-hop were musical genres that developed within the African-American subcultures of America’s largest cities. Fusing funk, disco and a do-it-yourself punk aesthetic, rap music quickly became the defining voice of a generation of young, angry and disenfranchised black youth. In this incisive documentary, the history of rap and hip-hop is explored as well as the larger social context of American race and class relations. Interviews with Ice-T, Queen latifah, KRS-One, Chuck D and Rakim explore the context of rap’s evolution and offer necessary defences of the music’s relevance and importance to African-American youth; especially in the context of a popular media that has often dismissed rap as misogynist or “inauthentic”. Made by two Australian brothers who fell in love with the music, this documentary gives a voice to the power, impact, originality and importance of rap and hip-hop.

results.title: Rangi and papa: the Maori creation myth
results.brief_description: The Maori myth about the creation of the Earth. Life began with the Sky Father and the Earth Mother, who gave birth to the gods of the sea, winds and storms, food, forests, plunder, and earthquakes. Animated film with script and illustrations by Robert Jahnke, photography by Lindsay Whipp and narrated by George Henare.

results.title: Bermuda, Bahama, Jamaica
results.creator_credit: Peter Teneyck and Video Trip Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rand McNally video visit trips”.
Tricia Springer takes you on a tour of three exotic ports of call in the Caribbean. Behind the picture postcard beauty of Bermuda is an island filled with activity, and British tradition. Turquoise waters and natural beauty await you in the Bahamas, which has a vital night life of discos, casinos and Las Vegas style shows. Jamaica is truly West Indian and is permeated by the calypso and reggae beats. Included are bonus tips on getting there, accommodation, food, special events, clothing and climate.

results.title: Random Harvest
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Sidney A. Franklin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Random Harvest is a romantic masterpiece. Based on the novel by James Hilton (who also wrote “Lost Horizons” and “Goodbye Mr Chips”) this is a story of a man’s loss of, and search for identity and a woman’s undying love and devotion. Consummate film artistry and intelligence make what we see and hear enthralling and moving. Stars Greer Garson and Ronald Colman. Rated: G

results.title: Rancho Notorious
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Howard Welsch and Fidelity Pictures
results.brief_description: A Story of hate, murder and revenge, this is Fritz Lang’s classic Western starring the great Marlene Dietrich in a typically sexy role. Vern Haskell (Arthur Kennedy) and his fiancee Beth (Gloria Henry) are to be married in 8 days time. One afternoon when Beth is minding her father’s store, two strangers ride into town. One of the men enters the store and tells her to open the safe, but it soon becomes obvious that he wants more than the money. From across the street a boy hears a gun shot ring out, and then sees a man make his escape. Vern is called and pushes through the crowd to find Beth dead. The stage is set for one of the great revenge western. In pursuit of Beth’s assaillant, Vern finds his way to Chuk-a-luck ranch, a safe haven for runaway outlaws run with an iron fist by Altar Keane (Marlene Dietrich) and her boyfriend Frenchy Fairmont (Mel Ferrer). Adpated to the screen by Daniel Taradash and Silvia Richards from her novel “Gunsight Whitman”.

results.title: Ran
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Masato Haro and Serge Silberman
results.brief_description: Set in 16th century Japan, an ageing ruler, Lord Hidetora attempts to peacefully divide his hard-won Kingdom among his three sons. Then ruthless ambition, evil plots woven by scheming advisers, and Hidetora’s own past savagery combine to spawn a whirlwind of chaos. It drives the old man insane, shatters his Kingdom and destroys his family. A visually extraordinary weaving of plot strands from “King Lear” with a Japanese folk legend. “Ran” translates as “Chaos”.
